revised_title: The Role of Two Photosynthetic Pigment Systems in Cytochrome Oxidation, Pyridine Nucleotide Reduction, and Fluorescence
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on photosynthesis in algae, discovering that two photosynthetic pigment systems work together to enhance photosynthesis. One system contains weakly fluorescent chlorophyll a, while the other contains fluorescent chlorophyll a and a large amount of phycoerythrin. These systems interact, leading to cytochrome oxidation, pyridine nucleotide reduction, and fluorescence. The findings provide a better understanding of the complex processes involved in photosynthesis.
